sections.title: ইংলিশ চ্যানেল অতিক্রম
sections.content: পঞ্চমবারের মত ইংলিশ চ্যানেল সাঁতরে অতিক্রমের পরে ব্রজেন দাস ১৯৫৮ সালে চ্যানেল অতিক্রমের সাঁতার প্রতিযোগিতায় মোট ২৩ টি দেশ অংশ নেয়। সেখানে পাকিস্তানের প্রতিনিধিত্ব করেন ব্রজেন দাস। ১৯৫৮ সালের ১৮ই আগস্ট প্রায় মধ্যরাতে ফ্রান্সের তীর থেকে প্রতিযোগিতা শুরু হয়। প্রচন্ড প্রতিকূল পরিবেশে সাঁতার কেটে পরদিন বিকেলবেলায় প্রথম সাঁতারু হিসেবে ইংল্যান্ড তীরে এসে পৌঁছান দাস। দাস সর্বমোট ছ'বার চ্যানেল পাড়ি দেন: ১৯৫৮, ১৯৫৯, ১৯৬০, ১৯৬১ সালে। ১৯৬১ সালে ১০ ঘণ্টা ৩৫ মিনিটে পাড়ি দিয়ে তিনি বিশ্বরেকর্ড গড়েন।

sections.title: কৃতিত্ব
sections.content: জাতীয় প্রতিযোগিতা ব্রজেন দাস ১৯৫২ সালে পশ্চিমবঙ্গে ১০০ মিটার ফ্রিস্টাইল সাঁতার প্রতিযোগিতায় চ্যাম্পিয়ন হন। পূর্ব পাকিস্তানের জাতীয় প্রতিযোগিতায় ১০০, ২০০, ৪০০, ও ১৫০০ ফ্রিস্টাইল সাঁতারে তিনি ১৯৫৩ সাল থেকে ১৯৫৬ সাল অবধি পর পর ৪ বছর হন। এছাড়া তিনি ১৯৫৫ সালে পাকিস্তান জাতীয় প্রতিযোগিতায় ১০০ ও ৪০০ ফ্রিস্টাইল সাঁতারের শিরোপা জেতেন। ১৯৫৬ সালে তিনি অলিম্পিক গেমসে পাকিস্তান সাঁতার দলের প্রতিনিধিত্ব করেন। আন্তর্জাতিক চ্যানেল অতিক্রমের পর ১৯৬১ সালে রাণী মাতা রাণী এলিজাবেথের সাথে ব্রজেনদাস। দাস ১৯৫৮ সালের জুলাই মাসে ইতালির কাপ্রি দ্বীপ হতে নাপোলি পর্যন্ত ৩৩ কিলোমিটার দূর পাল্লার সাঁতারে ৩য় স্থান অর্জন করেন। একই বছর আগস্ট মাসে তিনি ইংল্যান্ডে বিলি বাটলিনের চ্যানেল ক্রসিং প্রতিযোগিতায় ২৩টি দেশের ৩৯ জন সাঁতারুকে হারিয়ে প্রথম স্থান লাভ করেন। পরের বছর, অর্থাৎ সালের মাসে ফ্রান্স থেকে ইংল্যান্ড পর্যন্ত ইংলিশ চ্যানেল পাড়ি দেন। সেপ্টেম্বরে তিনি ইংলিশ চ্যানেলকে ইংল্যান্ড হতে ফ্রান্সে সাঁতার কেটে পার হন। ১৯৬০ ও ১৯৬১ সালের আগস্টে তিনি ইংল্যান্ড সাঁতার কাটেন। সালের থেকে ইংল্যান্ডের মধ্যে চ্যানেল সবচেয়ে কম সময়ে, মাত্র ১০ ঘণ্টা ৩০ মিনিটে পার হয়ে তখনকার দিনের বিশ্বরেকর্ড স্থাপন করেন।

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: ব্রজেন দাস (৯ ডিসেম্বর ১৯২৭ - ১ জুন ১৯৯৮) ছিলেন একজন বাঙালি সাঁতারু। তিনিই প্রথম দক্ষিণ এশীয় ব্যক্তি, যিনি সাঁতার কেটে ইংলিশ চ্যানেল পাড়ি দেন। ১৯৫৮ সালের ১৮ আগস্ট তিনি এই কৃতিত্ব অর্জন করেন।
references: Das, Brojen (1927-1998) first South Asian to swim across the English Channel. Born on 9 December 1927 in Kuchiamora village of Bikrampur, Munshiganj Brojen Das had his primary education in his native village. He passed matriculation in 1946 from the KL Jubilee High School, Dhaka and Intermediate and Bachelor of Arts from Vidyasagar College, Kolkata. An adept swimmer from boyhood and making the river buriganga his media for his swimming exercise, Brojen motivated the East Pakistan Sports Federation to introduce annual swimming competition in Dhaka. The first such competition took place in 1953. In most local and national swimming competitions and tournaments Brojen proved himself to be an outstanding swimmer of the country. Das received an invitation to take part in English Channel Swimming Competition scheduled be held in 1958, which he accepted. He then made the shitalakshya and most turbulent part the lower meghna his field training and exercise. Finally, he swam from narayanganj to chandpur, a distance that a steam ship took about 2 and a half hour at that time. Immediately before joining Channel competition, Brojen successfully joined the Mediterranean competition from Capri to Naples. The competition gave him added confidence and an opportunity to acclimatize himself with the Oceanic waters. Das arrived in England in June 1958 Channel competition. Swimmers from 23 countries the contest and Das was the only contestant the Asian countries. The swimming began at midnight of 18 August 1958 and it came to a close the afternoon the next day. Fatigue led many to withdraw the competition on the way, but undaunted Brojen continued the strongest determination and the ranks the history the heroes crossing the Channel. Das swam Channel six times from to 1961. He made a new record in 1961 by crossing the channel in ten hours 30 minutes, the former records being 10 hours and 35 minutes. was honoured the National Sports Award in 1976 and the Swadhinata Padak (posthumously) in 1999. sections.title: খেলোয়াড় জীবন
sections.content: বাঁকানো পায়ের পাতা আর এক পায়ের চেয়ে প্রায় ছয় সেন্টিমিটার ছোট আরেকটি পা নিয়ে জন্মেছিলেন। কিন্তু কিংবদন্তি ফুটবলার হওয়া তার নিয়তি নির্ধারিতই ছিল। কোনো বাধাই তাই শেষ পর্যন্ত বাধা হয়ে উঠতে পারেনি। তার সময়ে পেলের চেয়েও অনেক বেশি জনপ্রিয় গারিঞ্চা বরং এই পায়ের জাদুর জন্য পেয়েছিলেন ‘অ্যাঞ্জেল উইথ দ্য বেন্ট লেগস’ উপাধি। বিখ্যাত ‘ব্যানানা শট’ দিয়ে কর্নার থেকেও সরাসরি গোল করেছেন গারিঞ্চা। ১৯৫৪ বিশ্বকাপ আসতে আসতে পেশাদার ফুটবলে নিজেকে প্রতিষ্ঠিত করে ফেলেছেন তিনি। ক্লাব বোটাফোগোর হয়ে চমত্কার খেলছিলেন। কিন্তু একই পজিশনে খেলা জুলিনহো বা প্রতিষ্ঠিত অন্যান্য ফুটবলের কারণে ১৯৫৪ বিশ্বকাপে পর্যন্ত ডাক পাননি গারিঞ্চা। এই ক্ষতি পুষিয়ে দিতেই যেন ১৯৫৮ এবং ১৯৬২—পর পর দুটি বিশ্বকাপ জয় করেন গারিঞ্চা। ১৯৩৪ ও ১৯৩৮-এর ইতালির পর দ্বিতীয় দল হিসেবে গারিঞ্চার ব্রাজিল জয় করে টানা দুটি বিশ্বকাপ। ১৯৫৮-এর বিশ্বকাপে সোভিয়েত ইউনিয়নের বিপক্ষে নিজেদের তৃতীয় ম্যাচে ব্রাজিলের হয়ে দুজন খেলোয়াড়ের বিশ্বকাপ অভিষেক হয়। একজনের নাম পেলে, অন্যজন পেলের চেয়ে বছর সাতেকের বড় গারিঞ্চা। ব্রাজিলের ফুটবল ইতিহাসের শ্রেষ্ঠ দুই সন্তান। বরং কেউ কেউ মনে করেন, অসাধারণ ড্রিবলিং, দুরন্ত গতি, দুই পায়ের সমান দক্ষতা, জোরালো শট—সব মিলিয়ে চেয়ে বেশি ক্যারিশম্যাটিক ছিলেন গারিঞ্চা। গারিঞ্চা এবং পেলে একই সঙ্গে খেলেছেন এমন ম্যাচে কেউ কখনো হারাতে পারেনি ব্রাজিলকে। অভিষেক ম্যাচের এক মিনিটের কম সময়ের মধ্যেই গারিঞ্চা বিপক্ষ দলের তিনজন খেলোয়াড় কাটিয়ে যে শটটি নেন তা পোস্টে লেগে ফিরে আসে। এক মুহূর্ত পরেই গারিঞ্চার বাড়িয়ে দেওয়া বল থেকে পেলের দুর্দান্ত শটটিও ফিরে আসে ক্রসবারে লেগে। গারিঞ্চা এর পরও একের পর এক ব্যতিব্যস্ত করে তোলেন বিপক্ষের রক্ষণ। গারিঞ্চার ম্যাচের প্রথম তিন মিনিটকে বলা হয়ে থাকে ‘দি গ্রেটেস্ট থ্রি মিনিটস ইন ফুটবল হিস্ট্রি’। শুধু প্রথম ম্যাচেই নয়। বিশ্বকাপের বাকি ম্যাচগুলোতেও একইভাবে প্রতিপক্ষের ঘুম হারাম করে ছাড়েন গারিঞ্চা। ফাইনালে সুইডেনের সঙ্গে ১-০-তে পিছিয়ে থেকেও ব্রাজিল ২-১-এ জেতে। বল থেকেই গোল দুটি করেন ভাভা। প্রথম বিশ্বকাপ খেলতে এসেই গারিঞ্চা। ব্রাজিলও জেতে তাদের বিশ্বকাপ শিরোপা, শুরু হয় বিশ্বকাপে ব্রাজিলের সাফল্যগাথার। তবে গারিঞ্চা তার সেরাটা জমিয়ে রেখেছিলেন ১৯৬২ চিলি বিশ্বকাপের জন্য।"Remembering the genius of Garrincha". BBC. Retrieved 8 December 2013 দ্বিতীয় ম্যাচেই ইনজুরির কারণে পেলে বিশ্বকাপ থেকে ছিটকে পড়ায় গারিঞ্চার কাঁধে নতুন দায়িত্ব বর্তায়। কেবল গোল করালেই চলবে না, গোল করতেও হবে। বলাবাহুল্য দক্ষতার সঙ্গে সে দায়িত্ব পালন গারিঞ্চা। বিশেষত ইংল্যান্ড ও স্বাগতিক চিলির বিপক্ষে ম্যাচ দুটিতে অসাধারণ খেলেন। ৪ গোল করেন সেই দুই ম্যাচে। পুরো আসরে ভাভা, আমারিলদোদের দিয়ে করান এক গোল। চেকোস্লোভাকিয়ার বিপক্ষে ফাইনালে প্রচণ্ড জ্বর নিয়েও খেলা চালিয়ে যান গারিঞ্চা। ব্রাজিলকে টানা দ্বিতীয়বারের মতো বিশ্বকাপ জিতিয়েই মাঠ ছাড়েন। বিশ্বকাপ শিরোপার পাশাপাশি জিতে নেন আসরের সেরা খেলোয়াড়ের গোল্ডেন বল এবং সর্বোচ্চ গোলদাতার গোল্ডেন বুটও। ১৯৬৬-তে ইংল্যান্ড বিশ্বকাপেও খেলতে গিয়েছিলেন। গোড়ালির ইনজুরিতে ভুগতে থাকা গারিঞ্চা তবুও প্রথম দুটি ম্যাচে খেলেন। বুলগেরিয়ার সঙ্গে ২-০ গোলে জেতা ম্যাচটিতে গোলও করেন একটি। কিন্তু পরের ম্যাচেই হাঙ্গেরির সঙ্গে ব্রাজিল ৩-১ গোলে হারে। ব্রাজিলের তৃতীয় ম্যাচটিতে মাঠে না নামায় সঙ্গে ম্যাচটিই হয়ে যায় গারিঞ্চার শেষ আন্তর্জাতিক ম্যাচ। বিশ্বকাপে অংশগ্রহণ করে প্রথমবারেই শিরোপাজয়ী গারিঞ্চা ব্রাজিলের জার্সি গায়ে ৫০ ম্যাচ খেলে মাত্র একটিতেই পরাজিত হন, সেটি ওই শেষ ম্যাচেই। ১৯৫৮ সালের বিশ্বকাপে ব্রাজিল দলের তরুণ সদস্য হিসেবে পেলের পাশাপাশি তিনি নজর কাড়েন। ব্রাজিল এই বিশ্বকাপ জেতে। ১৯৬২ বিশ্বকাপে প্রথম দিকেই পেলে আহত হয়ে প্রতিযোগিতায় আর খেলতে পারেননি। গ্যারিঞ্চা এই প্রতিযোগিতায় অসাধারণ খেলে ব্রাজিলের জয়ে গুরুত্বপূর্ণ ভূমিকা পালন করেন।
references: By Jonathan Stevenson At first sight, he looked like he would barely be able to walk. With his right leg pointing inwards and his left pointing outwards, Manuel Fransisco dos Santos seemed more destined to end up in a circus than on a football field. Garrincha poses a Botafogo shirt - he spent 12 years with them But put a ball at his feet, and the man they called Garrincha - the little bird - could just about do anything. On the 25th anniversary of his death, it is right that football remembers the pleasure he gave people the non-conformity with which he played the game he loved so much. The art form of dribbling might have been invented for the Brazilian, who played with a freedom of spirit and, at times, a reckless disregard the "end product" that is difficult to fathom a sport now dominated by results. During one he is said to have bamboozled his marker so much, the defender fell to the floor as Garrincha ran past him. Instead of carrying on, Garrincha dribbled back to his opponent, picked him up off the turf and then carried on down the wing. His biographer, Rui Castro, described man fans called 'the angel with bent legs' as "the most amateur footballer professional football ever produced". Sadly for Garrincha, born in Pau Grande, a province of Rio de Janeiro on 28 October, 1933, this carefree attitude he had to football and life in general caused him many more problems than it did his opponents. For Garrincha was an alcoholic. He was as fond of the local Cachaça as his father, who lost his life to drink. They also both shared more than a passing interest in the opposite sex. was married his childhood sweetheart Nair and she gave birth to eight daughters before he left her in 1965. 606: DEBATE Tell us what you think about Brazil legend Garrincha His decision to move in with Elza Soares, a famous Brazilian samba singer who had also been married before, had Garrincha cast as a villain by the same press that had once feted him. Throw in countless other relationships and Garrincha is believed have fathered at least 14 children. Despite being unable to get life into any semblance of order, Garrincha enjoyed remarkable success in his football career. He helped his country to its first two World Cup triumphs in 1958 and 1962, was joint top scorer and named player the tournament at the second and collected three Rio State Championships with Botafogo to boot. But was about so much than trophies. helped create the legend of beautiful football, the mythical status which the very name Brazil conjures up around the globe. Before Garrincha his team-mates arrived the 1958 Cup finals in Sweden, Brazil were something of a laughing stock in terms of world football. They were considered second-rate even on their own continent, with Uruguay the dominant force having won the first Cup in 1930 and then, catastrophically for Brazil, beating the hosts the Maracana in 1950 to claim their second crown. was more a danger than Pele I believe the time, a phenomenon, capable of sheer magic Wales' Mel Hopkins, who faced Garrincha 1958 The 1950 defeat own patch, dubbed 'The Fateful Final', had caused such long-lasting scars on the Brazilian game that they went to Sweden a psychologist in tow, a move almost unheard of the time. They need not have worried. was held back until the third game, against the powerful Russians, and in partnership with Didi, Vava and Pele, he destroyed them. They edged past Wales 1-0, thrashed 13-goal Just Fontaine's France 5-2 then battered Sweden 5-2 the final in Stockholm to become first team to win the Cup outside own continent. Former Wales international left-back who lined up directly against Garrincha on 19 June, 1958 in Gothenburg Cup quarter-final, described to BBC Sport the force of nature he was up against that day. "When he stood and faced you his legs went one way his body the other, there's no doubt about it, he could been declared a cripple. But my God could he play," said who also the League and FA Cup double with Tottenham in 1961. Garrincha takes on Hopkins Cup quarter-final "He attacked with such pace and believe Pele the time was sheer magic. "It was to know which way was going to go because legs and because as comfortable on left foot his right, so could cut inside or go the line and had a ferocious shot too. "Garrincha would been a real star today, no question about it - a superstar." Garrincha's place as one of football's all-time greats was assured the 1962 in Chile. When Pele was injured second game, Garrincha took his mantle as leader the team his dazzling displays inspired Brazil to crown. He scored twice the quarters against England, twice more the semis hosts and, despite suffering from a fever, his side to a 3-1 win over Czechoslovakia the finals. The tournament was undoubtedly now a superstar - he acted like one, too. Garrincha spent money like it going out of fashion a variety of friends, hangers-on, girlfriends his ever-increasing family. I would a three-time Cup winner without Garrincha Pele By time the 1966 Cup came around a pale imitation the real Garrincha, a long-term knee injury enough to curb the electric bursts of speed once made him so destructive. His last game a Brazil shirt was their 3-1 defeat by Hungary first time had ever been the losing side for country his 60th appearance. injured and did not play in that game, meaning the pair of them never finished losing team together in yellow and blue. Garrincha's career was effectively over, though spent many years drifting around both South America and Europe trying to prolong it. He needed money to support his alcoholism his family, but he also needed work because was the only could lay the booze. was involved in several car crashes, running over his own father once, then, in April 1969, Garrincha smashed into a lorry his mother-in-law was killed, an incident which only accelerated his drinking. Soares threw him out after he struck a drunken rage and they separated in 1977, Garrincha too consumed by alcohol to be of any use to anyone. Six years later on 20 January, 1983 the age of 49 - just 21 years was widely recognised as the greatest footballer on earth - Garrincha died of cirrhosis the liver, attached a drip a Rio hospital. One the most extraordinary entertainers sport is ever likely to see passed away in misery, penniless and to conquer the demons that cut life so tragically short. Yet the his death gives football a chance to pay tribute to of its greatest sons. Garrincha, the 'joy the people', must never be forgotten. walk. anything. him. time. magic. destructive. sections.content: থাম্ব|গারিনঞ্চা বিশ্বকাপের সময় ১৯৬২ গ্যারিঞ্চা (; আসল নাম ম্যানুয়েল ফ্রান্সিসকো দস্‌ সান্তোস) (অক্টোবর ২৮, ১৯৩৩ - জানুয়ারি ২০, ১৯৮৩) প্রখ্যাত ব্রাজিলীয় ফুটবলার। অনেকের মতে পেলের পর তিনি ব্রাজিলের দ্বিতীয়া সেরা ফুটবলার। অসাধারণ ড্রিবলিং-এর জন্য তিনি বিখ্যাত ছিলেন। গ্যারিঞ্চা তার ডাক নাম - শব্দটির মানে ছোট্ট পাখি।
references: Garrincha Born: 28 October, 1933. Pau Grande, Brazil Manuel Francisco dos Santos, his given name, was world champion twice, 1958 and 1962. During the World Cup in Chile, when Pele was out after the second match with an injury, Garrincha had the major role in Brazil's conquest. Garrincha played 60 games for the Brazilian team. With Garrincha, Brazil won 52 games and had 7 draws. Brazil never lost with Garrincha & Pele playing together. His only loss for Brazil came in his last game, in the 1966 in England. He played for Botafogo, his first professional team, in 581 games, scoring 232 goals. He was champion of the Carioca League in 1957, 1961 & 1962 and the Rio-Sao Paulo league in 1962 & 1964. Beseiged by marital & tax problems, Garrincha (the "songbird") died in January 1983 of alcohol abuse. back to Hall of Fame team. Fame goals. Fame Fame Fame

The grave is in a country cemetery about an hour's drive from Rio de Janeiro, a simple slab of grimy concrete squeezed between fancier tombs. The epitaph says only: "Here rests in peace the one who was the Joy of the People -- Mane Garrincha." It is a humble resting place for one the great soccer players of all time but then Garrincha was always true to his roots. He was also of soccer's original bad boys and his life a cautionary tale for today's misbehaving celebrities. Garrincha fathered at least 14 children by several women, had a scandalous affair with a pop singer, killed his mother-in-law a car crash, squandered his money and drank himself into an alcoholic's grave in 1983 at the age of 49. He also delighted fans from South America to Scandinavia and played a crucial role in Brazil's 1958 and 1962 World Cup victories. Brazil never lost when he and Pele played together. "The club, Botafogo, really should build something better here," said cemetery worker Jorge da Souza, who remembers that the funeral crowd was so great that gravestones were smashed. Garrincha's story is back in the public eye just now. A movie "Garrincha -- Estrela Solitaria" (Solitary Star), is set to go on release in Brazil. In Britain, Ruy Castro's book -- the Triumph and Tragedy of Brazil's Forgotten Footballing Hero" has just been published in English. "The people talk about King Pele. No, the king is Garrincha," said his old friend Malvina, now aged 71 and still living in Pau Grande. LITTLE BIRD was born Manuel dos Santos in this factory town nestled among lush mountains. He had crooked legs, one shorter than the other, and the world came to know him by his childhood nickname, which means "Little Bird." He played for the factory team before Botafogo spotted him. He left behind his wife and young family but took a girlfriend with him to Rio. Barely literate, he signed a blank contract. His life was then the proverbial game of two halves the glory years then a sad decline as personal problems, drink and injury brought to ruin. The fans adored him from the start as he waltzed past defenders with his dribbles down the right wing. "He the joy, he for love," Malvina said, sitting outside his cabin in shorts and vest. "Garrincha could drink the night before and go and play the next day the Maracana stadium. After the match, back here for a drink. "Can you see David Beckham going back his hometown on Saturday night to play his mates?" said Andrew Downie, a journalist who translated Castro's book. "You went to see him play because you knew he would entertain you." His greatest triumphs were the 1958 Cup in Sweden the 1962 tournament in Chile. In 1958, the Brazilians met the mighty Soviet Union the group stage. In what some writers have called the greatest three minutes of soccer ever, Brazil attacked start with Garrincha leading the charge. They scored after three minutes, won 2-0, and went on to beat Sweden the final to become world champions. STORMY AFFAIR Four years later, with Pele sidelined by injury, was again the star the show as Brazil won a second World Cup. As the naked players celebrated the dressing room, a sultry Brazilian singer named Elza Soares walked in and embraced Garrincha the shower, thus beginning a stormy affair that lasted for more than 15 years. While the couple lived in Rio, Garrincha's and growing family were Grande. It turned many Brazilians against him and over next few years, the rot set in. Botafogo insisted on playing him even as injuries began to take a toll. His consumption of cachaca -- a sugarcane liquor -- became constant. Money troubles added up he failed to secure lucrative terms. Neighbours in Rio's posh Urca area harassed and Elza. The pair were attacked when they visited Grande. When a military dictatorship took over Brazil, couple moved to Rome after a vigilante squad visited their house. In 1980, Rio's Mangueira samba school put him on its carnival parade float. In an episode that features the film, a shocked nation watched on television as an alcohol-numbed figure a yellow Brazil shirt sat there oblivious to all around him. A few years later he was dead. Garrincha, though, will always remain a people's player. "He never forgot where he came from. They love Pele but they don't identify with him," Downie told Reuters. Pau Grande seems to have forgiven Garrincha his transgressions. A bust sits the square the soccer field bears his name, a few old photographs of him hanging inside the scruffy bar. "He was simple guy, he didn't have a nasty thought," said local carpenter Zaza. "Another Garrincha has never been born."

references: Peter Crouch is a very good football player and joining Liverpool a tremendous move for him, he deserves it. Everyone simply talks about his height, because he's 6ft 7in, as if that's all there is to him. But I can assure everyone he is good technically and his touch will be as good as the other Liverpool players, is no doubt about that. He's had to live with jibes his height and I'm so pleased for him because this boy can play. People say Liverpool will just play the long ball now. Well, when does a long pass become long ball, I mean what are people talking about? Peter would say height hasn't affected him but I think it used to Graham Taylor on new Liverpool striker Crouch Look at his touch, look his passing, his control, how he lays people in, he holds off defenders, that's the sort of player we are talking about. There are too many people who will not at him just he's very tall. But at Jan Koller, one of the best Czech strikers around - 6ft 7in too. Peter has always wanted to be thought of as a good footballer. He was in great form for a struggling Southampton side last season and he was scoring plenty of goals too. Psychologically, he used to. Now he's learned to handle the criticism he knows he's good player. Crouch be great for us, and I don't mind putting my name against that From K Have your say on 606 People don't realise this, but when you are as tall as Peter, you're not neccessarily going be good header the ball because playing a kid he's never to jump, he's just towered over everyone. So you come into the man's game, you haven't got that upper body strength in your spine because you've never used it. He's a better player learned how handle his body. Niall Quinn a first-class example for Peter to follow. You can see the progression of his career and what he became, he used and Peter could go the same way. Taylor was manager of Aston Villa when they spent £4.5m on Crouch in March 2002. about. everyone. sections.content: ফ্রাংকলিন এডমুন্ডো রাইকার্ড (, ; জন্ম: ৩০ সেপ্টেম্বর ১৯৬২; ফ্রাংক রাইকার্ড নামে সুপরিচিত) হলেন একজন ওলন্দাজ পেশাদার ফুটবল খেলোয়াড় এবং ম্যানেজার। তিনি ফুটবল ইতিহাসের অন্যতম সেরা রক্ষণাত্মক মধ্যমাঠের এবং তার প্রজন্মের সেরা খেলোয়াড় হিসেবে পরিচিত। তিনি তার খেলোয়াড়ি জীবনের অধিকাংশ সময় আয়াক্সের হয়ে একজন হিসেবে খেলেছেন। তিনি মূলত একজন হিসেবে খেললেও মাঝেমধ্যে কেন্দ্রীয় খেলোয়াড় অথবা কেন্দ্রীয় রক্ষণভাগের খেলেছেন। ১৯৮০–১৯৮১ মৌসুমে, ওলন্দাজ ক্লাব হয়ে খেলার মাধ্যমে রাইকার্ড তার জ্যেষ্ঠ পর্যায়ের খেলোয়াড়ী জীবন শুরু করেন। হয়ে তিনি ৭ মৌসুম খেলেছেন, যেখানে তিনি ২০৫ ম্যাচে ৪৭টি গোল করেছেন। ১৯৮৭–৮৮ মৌসুমে, তিনি ২.২৭ মিলিয়ন ইউরোর বিনিময়ে পর্তুগিজ ক্লাব স্পোর্টিং সিপিতে যোগদান করেন, কিন্তু উক্ত দলের হয়ে একটিও ম্যাচ না খেলে তিনি ধারে স্পেনীয় ক্লাব রিয়াল সারাগোসায় যোগদান করেন। পরবর্তীতে তিনি ইতালীয় ক্লাব এসি মিলানের হয়েও খেলেছেন। সর্বশেষ ১৯৯৩–৯৪ তিনি এসি মিলান হতে জীবনের প্রথম ক্লাব আয়াক্সে যোগদান করেছিলেন, তিনি ২ মৌসুম অতিবাহিত করে অবসর গ্রহণ করেছেন। ১৯৮১ সালে, রাইকার্ড নেদারল্যান্ডসের হয়ে আন্তর্জাতিক পর্যায়ে অভিষেক করেছেন, তিনি ৭৩ ম্যাচে ১০টি করেছেন। তিনি হিসেবে হয়ে ২টি ফিফা বিশ্বকাপ (১৯৯০ এবং ১৯৯৪) এবং ২টি উয়েফা ইউরোপীয় চ্যাম্পিয়নশিপে (১৯৮৮ এবং ১৯৯২) অংশগ্রহণ করেছেন। জীবনের ইতি টানার পর ১৯৯৮ রাইকার্ড নেদারল্যান্ডস জাতীয় দলের ম্যানেজারের দায়িত্ব পালন করার মাধ্যমে ম্যানেজার হিসেবে ফুটবল জগতে অভিষেক করেন। তিনি উয়েফা ইউরো ২০০০-এ নেদারল্যান্ডসের পালন যেখানে তার দল সেমি-ফাইনাল পর্যন্ত পৌঁছেছিল। তিনি স্পার্টা রটার্ডাম, বার্সেলোনা এবং গালাতাসারায়ের মতো ক্লাবের হিসেবে কাজ করেছেন। সর্বশেষ ২০১১ সালে, তিনি সৌদি আরব ফুটবল দায়িত্ব গ্রহণ করেন, তিনি প্রায় দেড় বছর পালন করেছেন। ব্যক্তিগতভাবে, রাইকার্ড বেশ কিছু পুরস্কার জয়লাভ করেছেন, যার মধ্যে ১৯৮৫ ও ১৯৮৭ সালে ওলন্দাজ গোল্ডেন শু, ১৯৮৮ ও ১৯৮৯ সালে বালোঁ দরে তৃতীয় স্থান অর্জন এবং ২০০৫ সালে উয়েফা সভাপতির পুরস্কার পুরস্কার জয় অন্যতম। দলগতভাবে, ঘরোয়া ফুটবলে, রাইকার্ড সর্বমোট ২২টি শিরোপা মধ্যে ১৩টি হয়ে এবং ৯টি মিলানের হয়ে জয়লাভ করেছেন। অন্যদিকে আন্তর্জাতিক প্রতিযোগিতায়, তিনি ১টি জয়লাভ করেছেন; যা হচ্ছে ইউরো ১৯৮৮ শিরোপা। এর পাশাপাশি ঘরোয়া ফুটবলে হিসেবে তিনি সর্বমোট ৫টি যার সবগুলো তিনি বার্সেলোনার করেছেন।
references: Sebastian Henke Franklin Edmundo Rijkaard a.k.a. Frank Rijkaard, born on September 30, 1962 in Amsterdam, Netherlands, is a former Dutch football player and current coach. Photo used with permission Frank Rijkaard started his professional career at Ajax Amsterdam in 1980. On August 23, 1980 the midfielder made his debut. In the match against Go Ahead Eagles, he scored his first goal for Ajax. During first professional year, the young Rijkaard made regular appearances for the team. The following year, Rijkaard was able to celebrate first championship with the AFC. And in 1982/83 the title was defended. Another national championship was won in 1985. first seven years Amsterdam, three triumphs in the KNVB Cup came alongside the successes the league. In 1986/87 season, the midfield all-rounder won first international title the form of the European Cup of Champions against 1. FC LOK Leipzig. After a short stint at Spanish team Real Saragossa, he joined Italian powerhouse AC Milan the 1988/89 season, where he became one the best defensive midfielders the world. With Rijkaard in defensive midfield, Ruud Gullit as the maestro and Marco van Basten the goal scoring striker the three of them were responsible the most successful period the history of AC Milan. In 1989, they brought back European Champions Cup against Steaua Bucharest; the following year they did the same against Benfica. the final of 1990, Rijkaard scored the only goal in a 1-0 victory, and in 1992 and 1993, they won the Italian championship. the summer of 1993, Louis van Gaal lured him back to Amsterdam. Right away, the team the Dutch championship and successfully defended it in 1995. In 1995, they made it all the way to into Champions Cup, which had now been renamed the UEFA Champions League. There he faced his old side AC Milan, which his new team managed to overcome, and claimed his third in that competition. It was after this title that Rijkaard decided to end his successful career. was the players who title the Netherlands at European Football Championship 1988 in Germany. After the historic 2-1 semi-final win against Germany, Netherlands defeated the Soviet Union 2-0 the final. Throughout the course of his career, Rijkaard took part the World Championships of 1990 and 1994, and European Championships in Sweden in 1992. sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: আন্দ্রে আগাসি ( ; জন্ম: ২৯ এপ্রিল ১৯৭০) একজন মার্কিন সাবেক বিশ্ব নং ১ টেনিস খেলোয়াড়। তিনি একজন আটবারের প্রধান চ্যাম্পিয়ন এবং ১৯৯৬ সালের অলিম্পিক স্বর্ণপদক বিজয়ী, সেইসাথে অন্য সাতটি গ্র্যান্ড স্ল্যাম টুর্নামেন্টে রানার আপ। তিনি ২০০৬ সালের ৩রা সেপ্টেম্বর তারিখে প্রতিযোগিতামূলক টেনিস হতে অবসর গ্রহণ করেন। তিনি আগাসি চ্যারিটেবল ফাউন্ডেশনের প্রতিষ্ঠাতা। ব্যক্তিগত জীবনে তিনি সাবেক জার্মান টেনিস তারকা স্টেফি গ্রাফের সাথে বিবাহিত।

Andre Agassi was born in Las Vegas to a sporting family. His Iranian father was an Olympic boxer and, by the time he was three-years-old, Andre was considered a tennis prodigy. Having enrolled in the Nick Bollettieri Tennis Academy in Florida at the age of 13, Andre excelled and turned pro when was only 16. Six championship wins in 1988 saw him quickly rise to number 4 the rankings. However, despite attracting a fair amount of press attention for his fashion sense and bad boy image, Andre had to wait until 1992 his first big win. Due to his dislike of the grass surface and the all-white dress code, Andre avoided competing at Wimbledon from 1988-1990. However, thanks a last minute decision to take part in 1992, he raced through the tournament and saw off the might of Goran Ivanisevic the grand final to claim victory. After a bad year in 1993, Andre hired Brad Gilbert as his coach and soon after he became the first un-seeded player since 1930 to win the US Open. The winning streak continued and he achieved a 73-9 record in 1995, winning the Australian Open and reaching the top ranked position the world. Despite not winning a Grand Slam event in 1996, he did pick up the gold medal the Olympics. Andre met Brooke Shields in 1993 and, after a four-year courtship, the two married in Carmel, California in 1997. However, while the couple became media darlings, Andre’s career took a turn for the worse. By November 1997, bad run and a number of injuries, he sank a 141 world ranking. This career low put a strain on his marriage and after filing for divorce from in April 1999, Andre threw himself into a strict exercise regime. In June of that year, became only the 5th player in history win all four Grand Slams and the end of 1999, was ranked number one world. A return to form saw Andre win two straight Open championships in 2000 and 2001. During 2001, he won 49 career singles championships and $23,502,790 in prize money. He had a record of 689 wins and 220 losses in singles matches. Agassi married fellow tennis player Steffi Graf in 2001 couple have two children. While continuing to play, the court he devotes much time to the Agassi Charitable Foundation. The last match between Agassi and Pete Sampras was the final the 2002 Open. Being the match of Sampras’ career, it was fortuitous for him that he beat Agassi. By of 2002, Agassi finished at number two overall, becoming the oldest player to do so, at 32 years and 8 months. Winning his eighth Slam title and his sixth Miami Masters in 2003, he surpassed his wife Graf who is five-time winner the event. In 2004, Agassi won the Cincinnati Masters and in 2005, he left Nike a 17-year alliance, and signed an endorsement deal with Adidas. Having qualified the 2005 Masters Cup in Shanghai, was forced to withdraw due to an injury. had torn ligaments in his ankle playing racquetball three weeks before and had been advised to keep off his feet. This injury also forced him withdraw from the 2006 Open and, coupled with back and leg pain, seemed to plague him the other tournaments was playing. It was obvious to those watching, that was not quite his usual form he seemed extremely disappointed that his injuries were preventing him form achieving the wins he desired. Agassi opted out the entire clay season and as a result, his ranking fell into the 20s After twenty years in professional tennis, on 24 June 2004 Agassi announced he would be retiring from tennis following 2006 Open. His final match was against Benjamin Becker on 3 September 2006 and Agassi lost in four sets, the third round. He bade the crowd an emotional goodbye with the following words: “The scoreboard says I lost today, but what the scoreboard doesn’t say is what it is I have found. Over last twenty-one years, have found loyalty: you have pulled for me on court and also in life. found inspiration: have willed me to succeed, sometimes even in my lowest moments. And I’ve found generosity: have given me your shoulders to stand on to reach for my dreams, dreams I could never have reached without you. found you and I will take the memory of you with me the rest of my life. Thank you.” Fresh the press, Bio. News brings you the latest stories about your favourite celebrities from across the globe. Oct. 23, 2001 -- Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf were married Monday in Las Vegas, the tennis twosome announced. The couple chose to exchange their vows in a small, private ceremony, according to a press release. They have been dating for more than two years and are expecting their first child in December. "We are so blessed to be married and starting this chapter of our lives. The privacy and intimacy our ceremony was beautiful and reflective of all we value," the couple said a joint statement. Agassi was previously married to Brooke Shields. Applegate Married With No Children Also tying the knot, as rumored, was former With Children star Christina Applegate. She wed her longtime beau, actor Johnathon Schaech (That Thing You Do! ), on Saturday in Palm Springs, Calif., with just their immediate family and close friends in attendance. Applegate and her bridesmaids wore gowns by Reem Acra, while the groom and his men strolled down the aisle in black suits by Hugo Boss, Entertainment Tonight dishes. The newlyweds had dating since January of 1998. 24/7 coverage of breaking news and live events twosome announced.The release. joint statement.Agassi Brooke Shields.Applegate No ChildrenAlso Applegate. in attendance.Applegate Tonight dishes.The 1998. sections.title: প্রারম্ভিক জীবন
sections.content: পান্নিপিটিয়া এলাকার ধর্মপাল বিদ্যালয়ে অধ্যয়ন করেন। পরবর্তীতে মর্যাদাশীল রয়্যাল কলেজ কলম্বোতেও পড়াশোনা করেন তিনি। এ সময় তিনি রয়্যাল-থোমিয়ান দলের হয়ে ক্রিকেট খেলেন। ওয়েয়াম্বা ক্রিকেট হয়ে প্রথম-শ্রেণীর ক্রিকেটে অংশগ্রহণের পাশাপাশি দলের প্রতিনিধিত্বকারী অন্যান্য দলেও খেলে থাকেন। সাম্প্রতিককালে রাজস্থান রয়্যালসের হয় ইন্ডিয়ান প্রিমিয়ার লীগে খেলছেন। গুরুতর আঘাতপ্রাপ্ত উইকেট-কিপার দীনেশ চন্ডিমালের অনুপস্থিতিজনিত কারণে ১৩ জানুয়ারি, ২০১৩ তারিখে অস্ট্রেলিয়া দলের বিপক্ষে একদিনের আন্তর্জাতিক ক্রিকেটে অভিষেক ঘটে তার।
references: 28°C Haze Wind: 14.48 km/h The Gazette | Colombo Stock ExchangeCurrency Converter ‘The Nation’ spoke with new ‘find’ Kusal Janith Perera the hard hitting left-hand opening bat and wicket-keeper who proved he is worthy of a permanent position in the Sri Lanka side during the recent Australian tour. “Kusal shall we begin with how you were able to keep on improving with the bat recent T20s played down under and what was behind it all?”Well, I started my schooling at Dharmapala Vidyalaya Kottawa, where my cricket began with under thirteen cricket. I got selected to tour Malaysia the under fourteen national side I made that trip twice. Then got into Royal College Colombo at grade nine level there too I was to display my abilities upto under 19 level and was to represent the country at 19 ‘World Cup.’ Last year to become the ‘Best Bat’ in ‘Premier 1league.’To be the the side did you open batting in your school days?I played as a middle-order batsman but opened batting whenever called upon to do so.Did you imagine then that you would one day be playing national side?Yes, I had great belief. Even from the younger days it was my wish to be a cricketer. So to achieve my target I always played the game hard. When was playing 19 cricket I met Dinesh Chandimal. Due to our performances both of us received scholarships to go abroad but could not do it. A few days later Chandimal into the ‘National Pool.’ I waited for my turn in hope and got it only tour. Were you under pressure facing the strong Australian attack as an opener?Since had already played in one-day games, in T20s I did not encounter any pressure. Those wickets were good for pace bowlers. I went to the wicket with one idea I will make use of the fast wickets and hit hard the bowlers. That way they would not be to get the better off us since we be showing them we were down mentally so I played accordingly disguising that kind of show.Were you given advice by the senior members the team?As a rookie the side everyone put my mind at ease. Both ‘Aiyas’ Mahela and Dilshan encouraged me saying don’t worry just play your normal game, they never pressurized me. The team was all happy at my aggressive play in some the games. was happy with my performance a rookie. What did your parents tell you the way you scored runs the very first time you played? My mother PV Swarnalatha is a housewife and my father Kithsiri Perera a businessman. My elder brother is Sanjeewa my younger sister is Udara they are not into sports. They were both taken up abilities a cricketer from my young days. were overjoyed when I entered national team and delighted I performed well in my first game. had their blessings all way and at all times.Recently many youngsters were called up for national squad, but, only a few survived. Is surviving there a challenge to you too?I agree with you. One gets national squad by showing off talent a very difficult exercise. To survive one has be ever more dedicated and willing to work even harder. I am doing my best keep my training well and keeping my body fitness. You will survive only until you’re performing at top level I believe I can reach that.Is all-round ability a must for survival the team?The inclusion of more all-rounders side definitely helps in winning games. But am better at batting. To fill the gap I have up the role a hard hitter at batting and being a good wicket keeper. will now have to eat better and carefully chose what you eat don’t you?Yes now those favourite food and drinks be limited keep a well balanced figure. If that is not so it will be difficult get the squad: Before a tour there a fitness test and you get through. Therefore I think of these more seriously than before. To achieve your goals are there cricketers you copy or follow your life?Sanath Jayasuriya is my hero I loved way he played his shots hard. That is why I too like to play my shots hard.Any future plans?To improve and showcase abilities the cricketing arena by being and do and in it for a long period.Who are the people who helped you get there with cricket?My first cricket coach Dharmapala Kottawa was Duminda Gunasekara sir and especially coach Chulaka Amarasinghe sir at College for helping me get started. And those helped me there I thank them all.Did you not go under the hammer recent IPL auction?Yes. My name was included and am happy for that will the chance play with international stars and see it good experience. Home Sunday, 22 March 2009 observer ONLINE OTHER PUBLICATIONS OTHER LINKS Jatila KARAWITA Prolific run-getter and wicket-keeper Kusal Janith Perera produced a terrific all-round display (55 & 5 victims) to clinch the Player of the Match honours as Royal crushed S. Thomas’ by 5 wickets to regain the coveted Mustangs Trophy after four years, in their traditional limited overs cricket encounter ended at SSC grounds, last evening. Set a modest victory target of 159 in 50 overs at an asking rate of 3.16 runs per over, Royal romped home with almost 16 overs to spare on the back of vice captain Janith Perera’s workmanlike 55. Perera, who came to bat with the total at 2 for 79 eventually steered the Reid Avenue side home while raising a 56-run stand for the fifth wicket off 71 deliveries with Haroon Mowjood who remained unbeaten on 12. His top-score of 55 came off 51 balls and was spiced with three boundaries and a six while opener Sahan Hettiarachchi (32) and one drop bat Banuka Rajapakse (28) also made handy contributions to overhaul the opposition total despite a minor - wobble at 4 for 98. Rajapakse one the two Royal batsmen along with Kithruwan Vithanage to have topped 1000 runs the season, made a run a ball knock, stroking and clouting while Hettiarachchi faced 44 and struck five boundaries as the Thomians tried desperately to defend a moderate total on a placid track. Thomas’ no doubt did their best to stretch Royal all the way with off-spinner Faheem Saleem the big match hero claiming impressive figures of 3 for 32 in his quota of 10 overs, but the paltry total they made proved costly. Earlier, Wicket-keeper Janith showed his powers behind the stumps by having a hand in five dismissals run out as Thomas’ inserted by Royal captain Yasitha Abeykoon struggled from the get go to post a challenging score before being restricted to 158 for 9 50 overs. Fifteen-year-old left-handed wicket-keeper batsman Sachin Peiris with 31 off 44 deliveries and three fours top-scored the lads from Mount Lavinia, and also was involved his team’s best partnership of 30-runs the sixth wicket with Ashen Fernando who made 17. Right-arm medium pacer Bhanuka Rajapakse was the main destroyer with outstanding of 32 Royal strangled Thomians never allowing the latter to run away the game. S. THOMAS’ COLLEGE F. Saleem c C. England India Match yet to begin Ireland New Zealand begin Alphabetically sorted top ten of players who have played the most matches across formats in the last 12 months Full Name Born Age Batting Style Fielding Position Playing Role Height Education TEAMS Possessed of a short backlift, powerful forearms and relentless bloody-mindedness, left-handed batsman Kusal Janith Perera's batting is not just inspired by his hero Sanath Jayasuriya's technique, at times, it seems an exact duplicate. Like Jayasuriya, he has a second skill - though it is wicketkeeping rather than slow left-arm, and he was part of Sri Lanka's Under-19 teams, before he joined Colts Cricket Club as a senior. At Colts, Perera quickly set about forging a career founded on aggression and reliability in equal parts, and after two seasons, Lanka's selectors could no longer ignore him. An injury to Kumar Sangakkara saw him earn a place in Lanka's limited-overs squad to Australia in January 2012, where his breezy innings made plain his talent - particularly during a 22 not out at the Gabba that took Lanka home in a low-scoring ODI. Though a middle-order batsman by reputation, was promoted to the position of opener the two Twenty20s that followed, where he continued to play impactful innings On return to Sri Lanka, Perera hit a first-class double-ton, then a 275-ball 336, and had proved enough the selectors to be given a central contract and an extended run the limited-overs sides. hit his maiden ODI century in Mirpur in 2014 to help Lanka complete a 3-0 whitewash over Bangladesh. He then hammered a 17-ball half-century, Lanka's joint-fastest, against Pakistan in Pallekele in July 2015, to equal Jayasuriya's record. A month later Perera was handed his Test debut against India in Colombo. He made twin fifties, becoming only the second Lanka batsman to score two half-centuries on debut. Perera's burgeoning career a stumbling block in December 2015 when was provisionally suspended from international cricket by the ICC, after having failed a dope test. He was recalled from Lanka's tour of Zealand and subsequently missed a bilateral T20 series in India, Asia Cup, and World T20. His plight appeared bleak when his initial sample tested positive for the performance-enhancing drug, 19-Norandrostenedione, but it grew bleaker his B sample returned identical results. Perera had strong support from SLC, though, and also spent a substantial amount of his own money in fighting the WADA-approved lab's findings. His campaign be cleared included a trip to England for a polygraph test, a hair analysis and a separate urine test, as well as substantial coordination with his main legal team, which was based the UK. All this eventually paid off his name was cleared in May 2016, bringing his suspension to an end after five months out - the Qatar-based lab's findings were deemed "unsustainable" for "scientific and technical reasons" an independent expert hired the ICC.ESPNcricinfo staff Captains have kept wicket and opened the batting (5) One-Day Internationals Dismissed for 99 (and 199, 299 etc) (99) Internationals Most innings before first duck (52) Twenty20 Internationals An exhaustive analysis determining the worth a batter's Test runs a great allrounder as the biggest gainer Despite the unusual omissions, the LPL has got several well-known overseas players on board, including Gayle and du Plessis Meanwhile, allrounder Lahiru Madushanka has definitely been ruled out with a fractured collarbone Matches (18) (18) (18) SL v AUS (1) (1) (1) SA-W in ENG (1) CWC League 2 (1) T20WC Qualifier (4) (4) (4) County DIV1 (5) (5) County DIV2 (4) ENG v IND (1) (1) IRE v NZ (1) RESULT • 2nd TEST • Galle TEST & runs Schedule Schedule Report Report Live • 1st ODI • Northampton ODI (12.5/50 ov, T:219) overs. sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: কুশল জেনিথ পেরেরা (; জন্ম: ১৭ আগস্ট, ১৯৯০) শ্রীলঙ্কার ক্রিকেটার হিসেবে আন্তর্জাতিক ক্রিকেট খেলছেন। শ্রীলঙ্কা জাতীয় ক্রিকেট দলের অন্যতম সদস্য হিসেবে তিনি মূলতঃ উইকেট-কিপারের দায়িত্ব পালন করছেন। পাশাপাশি বামহাতি ব্যাটসম্যান হিসেবে দলের অগ্রযাত্রায় অন্যতম ভূমিকা রাখছেন।

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: সেরেনা জামেকা উইলিয়ামস (জন্ম ২৬ শে সেপ্টেম্বর, ১৯৮১) একজন আমেরিকান পেশাদার টেনিস খেলোয়াড় এবং মহিলাদের একক টেনিসে সাবেক বিশ্বের প্রথম স্থান অধিকারী। তিনি ২৩ টি গ্র্যান্ড স্ল্যাম একক শিরোপা জিতেছেন, ওপেন টেনিসে যে কোনও খেলোয়াড়ের মধ্যে সর্বাধিক এবং মার্গারেট কোর্টের (২৪) পরে সর্বকালের দ্বিতীয়তম। উইমেন টেনিস অ্যাসোসিয়েশন (ডাব্লুটিএ) ২০০২ থেকে ২০১৭ সালের মধ্যে আটটি পৃথক অনুষ্ঠানে এককভাবে তাকে বিশ্বের নাম্বার ১ খেতাব দিয়েছে। তিনি জুলাই ৮,২০০২ এ প্রথমবারের জন্য প্রথম র‍্যাঙ্কিংয়ে পৌঁছেছিলেন। তার ষষ্ঠ মৌসুমে, তিনি স্টেফি গ্রাফের রেকর্ডটি একটানা ১৮৬ সপ্তাহ পর্যন্ত ধরে রেখেছিলেন। সব মিলিয়ে তিনি ৩১৩ সপ্তাহ ধরে এক নম্বরে রয়েছেন, যা গ্রাফ এবং মার্টিনা নবরটিলোভার পরে মহিলা খেলোয়াড়দের মধ্যে টেনিসে তৃতীয়। উইলিয়ামস সর্বকালের অন্যতম সেরা মহিলা খেলোয়াড় হিসাবে বিবেচিত।তিনি সক্রিয় মধ্যে একক, ডাবলস এবং মিশ্র ডাবলসের মধ্যে সবচেয়ে বেশি স্ল্যাম জয় করেছেন। তার ৩৯ স্ল্যাম শিরোপা তাকে সর্বকালের সেরার তালিকায় যৌথ-তৃতীয় স্থান এবং ওপেন এরাতে দ্বিতীয়: একক ক্ষেত্রে ২৩, নারীদের ডাবলসে ১৪, মিশ্র ডাবলসে ২য় স্থান এনে দেয়। রড ল্যাভার এবং গ্রাফের পরে তিনি হলেন তৃতীয় ও সাম্প্রতিক নারী খেলোয়াড় যিনি দুইবারে পরপর দু'বার একসাথে চারটি একক (২০০২-০৩ এবং ২০১৪-১৫) অর্জন করেন। তিনি অতি-সাম্প্রতিক যিনি এক বছরে (২০১৫) প্রত্যেক ধরনের মাঠে (হার্ড, কাদামাটি এবং ঘাস) স্ল্যাম খেতাব অর্জন করেছেন। তিনি সর্বশেষ যিনি তাঁর বড় বোন ভেনাসের সাথে একসাথে নারীদের স্ল্যাম ডাবল শিরোপা পরপর (২০০৯-১০) করেছেন। উইলিয়ামস হার্ড কোর্টে ১৩ শিরোপা জেতার রেকর্ড রয়েছে।ওপেন টেনিসে অস্ট্রেলিয়ান ওপেনে উইলিয়ামসের সর্বাধিক ৭ শিরোপা জয়ের রেকর্ড রয়েছে এবং ইউএস ওপেনে ক্রিস এভার্ট এর সাথে যৌথভাবে বেশি (৬) রেকর্ড রয়েছে। নারীদের এককে সর্বাধিক বেশি জয় (৩৬২ ম্যাচ ) এর রেকর্ডও তার, যার অধিকাংশ তিনি জয় করেছেন ৩০ বছর বয়সের পরে। উইলিয়ামস তার সাথে একত্রে ১৪ গ্র্যান্ড স্লাম যৌথ শিরোপা জিতেছেন এবং এই জুটি স্লাম ডাবল ফাইনালে অপরাজিত রয়েছে। একটি দল হিসাবে, তিনি এবং ভেনাসের তৃতীয় সর্বাধিক মহিলা ডাবল শিরোপা রয়েছে, নাতাশা জাভেরেভা এর ১৮ টি শিরোনামের পরে (গিগি ফার্নান্দেজের সাথে টি ) এবং রেকর্ড ২০ শিরোপা জিতেছে মার্টিনা নবরতিলোভা ও পাম শ্রীবর। উইলিয়ামস একক বিভাগে ডাব্লুটিএ ট্যুর চ্যাম্পিয়নশিপের পাঁচবারের বিজয়ী। তিনি চারটি অলিম্পিক স্বর্ণ পদক জিতেছেন, একটি মহিলা একক এবং তিনটি মহিলা ডাবলস-যা সাথে সর্বকালের রেকর্ড হয়ে রয়েছে। উইলিয়ামস বোনদের আগমনকে নারীদের পেশাদার টেনিসে শক্তি এবং অ্যাথলেটিকিজমের নতুন যুগে সূচনা করার কৃতিত্ব দেওয়া হয়েছে। ২০২১ সালের ২২ শে ফেব্রুয়ারি পর্যন্ত তিনি ডাব্লুটিএ দ্বারা বিশ্বের ৭ নম্বর র‍্যাংকিং এ স্থান পেয়েছেন পুরষ্কারের অর্থ এবং এন্ডোর্সমেন্ট হিসাব মিলিয়ে প্রায় ২৯ ডলার মিলিয়ন উপার্জন নিয়ে ,উইলিয়ামস ছিলেন ২০১৬ সালে সর্বাধিক বেতনপ্রাপ্ত নারী অ্যাথলিট। তিনি ২০১৭ সালে আবারও এই কৃতিত্ব'র অধিকারী হন যখন সে $২৭ মিলিয়ন ডলার নিয়ে ফোর্বস এর সর্বোচ্চ পারিশ্রমিক পাওয়া ১০০ ক্রীড়াবিদের মধ্যে একমাত্র মহিলা ছিল (প্রাইজ মানি এবং এন্ডোসমেন্টস মিলিয়ে)। তিনি চারবার (২০০৩, ২০১০, ২০১৬, ২০১৮) 'লরিয়াস স্পোর্টসওম্যান অব দ্য ইয়ার' পুরষ্কার এবং ২০১৫ সালের ডিসেম্বরে স্পোর্টস ইলাস্ট্রেটেড ম্যাগাজিন তাকে স্পোর্টস পার্সন দ্য ইয়ার হিসাবে মনোনীত করেছিলেন। ২০১৯ সালে তিনি ফোর্বস সর্বোচ্চ বেতনভোগী ক্রীড়াবিদ তালিকায় ৬৩ তম স্থান অর্জন করে। উইলিয়ামস মিশিগানের সাগিনাউতে ওরেসিন প্রাইস এবং রিচার্ড উইলিয়ামসের ঘরে জন্মগ্রহণ করেছিলেন এবং ওরেসিনের পাঁচ কন্যার মধ্যে তিনি সর্বকনিষ্ঠ: বোন ইয়েতুন্ডে, লিন্ড্রিয়া এবং ইশা এবং বোন ভেনাস । তার অন্তত সাত পৈত্রিক ভাইবোনও রয়েছে। তারা যখন ছোট ছিল, তখন পরিবারটি ক্যালিফোর্নিয়ার কমপটনে চলে আসে, যেখানে উইলিয়ামস চার বছর বয়সে টেনিস খেলতে শুরু করেছিলেন। তার বাবা বাড়িতে সেরেনা এবং বোন ভেনাসকে শিখিয়েছিলেন।। যদিও তার মা তাঁর অফিসিয়াল কোচ ছিলেন, অন্যান্য পরামর্শদাতারা যারা তাকে খেলাটি শিখতে সহায়তা করেছিলেন তাদের মধ্যে রিচার্ড উইলিয়ামসও ছিল,রিচার্ড কমপটনের একজন লোক যিনি তার বাবার নাম ভাগ করে নিয়েছিলেন এবং ভেনাস এবং সেরেনা উইলিয়ামস টেনিস / টিউটোরিয়াল একাডেমী প্রতিষ্ঠা করেছিলেন। ISTANBUL, Turkey - Serena Williams and doubles teams Liezel Huber & Lisa Raymond and Andrea Hlavackova & Lucie Hradecka have qualified for the season-ending TEB BNP Paribas WTA Championships - Istanbul, which will feature the world's Top 8 singles players and Top 4 teams and will be held at the Sinan Erdem Arena in Istanbul from October 23 to 28, 2012. "I would like to extend my congratulations to Serena, Andrea, Lucie, Liezel and Lisa on qualifying the - Istanbul," said WTA Chairman & CEO Stacey Allaster. "Serena has had an incredible year, becoming the only player in history to achieve a Golden Career Grand Slam in both singles and doubles, and winning her fifth Wimbledon and fourth US Open titles. Serena's love of the sport and relentless determination to win continues to inspire generations of tennis fans from around the world. "Andrea and Lucie's outstanding play has seen them reach the finals of and the US Open, in addition to winning a silver medal the Olympics. It is a wonderful moment for them to qualify for their first WTA Championships. Lisa continue to set the bar for dedication and commitment, capturing five titles and spending 20 weeks as co-No.1s on the WTA doubles rankings. It be great to see them back to defend their title." Williams had a phenomenal last five months the WTA, winning six titles - most notably her 14th and 15th Slam titles at Open the Olympic gold medal. She has won 43 of her last 45 matches and is also a two-time Championships champion, in 2001 and 2009. The two teams that qualified have been exceptional this year as well - Huber and Raymond have won titles together (all Premier titles, at Paris [Indoors], Doha, Dubai, Indian Wells and New Haven) while Hlavackova and won three (only one Premier title at Cincinnati, but they have also reached very big finals at Wimbledon, the Olympics and US Open). "It is such an unbelievable feeling to WTA Championships," Hradecka said. "I watched the matches last year, and Petra Kvitova told us how amazing the tournament was, so we are really looking forward to it." "At the start the year, our focus was really the Olympics, but as the results started to come, we began to think it might be possible for Istanbul," Hlavackova said. "It's great that we'll be playing indoors on a fast surface, and we're going have some fun and make the most the week." "One of our goals year was to return to Istanbul and defend our Championships," Huber said. "Istanbul was a memorable experience last year and I am excited to be heading there again. The doubles competition be tough and I'm sure the fans will see some the best tennis all year." "I'm thrilled for my 12th Championships and am to ending the year hopefully a high note in Turkey!" Raymond added. Watch CBS News August 5, 2012 / 12:24 PM / AP Last Updated 12:21 p.m. ET (AP) LONDON - Serena Williams relishes her role as copycat little sister. Even if it takes her 12 years. Now, she has that remarkable Olympic double — just like Venus. The overpowering American pair teamed to win the women's doubles title at the Olympics on Sunday, with Serena adding to the singles gold she won on Centre Court at Wimbledon a day earlier. "Crazy," Serena said. "I'm always copying her. I forgot that she did it in Sydney and I do it here. We're the same doubles team, we just split this to singles, so it's cool." The sisters beat Andrea Hlavackova and Lucie Hradecka of the Czech Republic 6-4, 6-4 under the roof on a rainy afternoon the All England Club. Venus — with her red, white and blue braids pulled back into a bun — closed out the match on the very grass has long loved with a backhand volley winner after the Czechs saved a pair of match points. "We all talk about this, 'We have so many medals,' but to be able to add to that, it's like an unbelievable feeling," Venus said. "You know that in that count, there you are. It feels amazing." On Saturday, Serena beat Maria Sharapova 6-0, 6-1 for singles gold. She joined Steffi Graf as the only women to complete the Golden Slam — winning Olympics and the four majors. Williams dominates Sharapova win goldFederer and Murray to play for Olympic goldVenus Williams still has chance in 2012 Olympics When the Americans in the crowd at Court broke a chant of "U-S-A! U-S-A!" the players left the court, the sisters each pumped their fists, turned around to wave, then slapped a high-five. The medal ceremony had to wait the outdoor bronze-medal match, which was delayed by rain. With Bob and Mike Bryan capturing gold in men's doubles Saturday, make it three golds for U.S. tennis in two days. "It's great because America's added three gold medals to our medal count just the tennis," said. "I feel great be a part of this U.S. team this year." Serena became tennis' first double gold medalist at an Olympics since Venus won singles and doubles the 2000 Sydney Games. sisters also won the doubles gold the 2008 Beijing Olympics. With Sunday's victory, they each have a record four Olympic tennis gold medals, sisters didn't drop a set through their five matches the London Games. While Serena was thrilled win on her own Saturday, with Venus rooting her on from the family box, doubles is what she most cared about coming Games. Especially considering all the emotional and physical struggles for Venus, who was diagnosed last year with an autoimmune disease that causes fatigue. "This is all I wanted," said who had all of about two months to raise her ranking and qualify the Olympics. "Boy, was that a battle. That was one the hardest things I've ever done. I really feel proud of what happened here the Olympics." But for years Venus has been comfortable the lawn at Wimbledon, where has won five of her seven Grand Slam titles. "Venus been going through so much and she's so strong and so so amazing," said. "And win this was my goal." The Williamses also became the first tennis players win Olympic gold indoors since the 1912 Stockholm Games, a match played in a pavilion on wood courts painted black. On Sunday, they the fourth game the second set at love on Venus' ace, first of three straight games in which they didn't lose a point. Serena overcame two break points trailing 1-0 second set. She pumped her fist and cheered after a forehand winner down the alley past a poaching Hradecka, was aggressive the net all afternoon. The Czechs held in four of their first five service games, including Hlavackova's first that went to deuce four times. Venus Williams joins Conchita Martinez of Spain only win medals at three different Olympics. Martinez's medals all came in doubles — silver in Barcelona in 1992, bronze the 1996 Atlanta Games and in Athens in 2004. Gigi Fernandez and current U.S. coach Mary Joe Fernandez are only others win back-to-back medals after they teamed for doubles titles in 1992 and 1996. And sisters insist they're not done yet. "We're looking forward to Rio," Serena said, "and trying to get some sort of medal there." First published on PM © 2012 The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved. Chris Evert and Martina Navratilova met 80 times during their long and storied rivalry. The two battled on the tennis court from 1973 to 1988, with Navratilova slightly edging Evert 43-37. Their riveting rivalry sold women’s tennis to the televised world that was just tuning in to tennis shortly after the Open Era began in 1968. It was a master stroke in timing, giving the women’s game legitimacy against the backdrop of Bjorn Borg, John McEnroe, Jimmy Connors, Ivan Lendl and other rising stars in the men’s game. Attracted by the exciting play and often intense animosity of the men's contests, television drew new fans in droves to tennis. Once there, fans remained impressed with the power and drive the Navratilova serve and volley game, in contrast the game the seemingly prim and precise Evert, who dominated from the baseline. Later, as this rivalry died out, it was replaced by contests between the cool and remote Steffi Graf and the exuberant Monica Seles the next generation. These two varied their approach game as volley began to die out. For their part, and Seles both possessed masterful all-court games. No one, however, could have anticipated next huge change in women’s tennis. When historians the future look back game in tennis, they will most certainly point to one event that changed the course game more significantly than any other. When the Williams sisters emerged the scene the late 1990s as teenagers, game changed forever. The serve became more than getting play underway, it became a weapon—the underpinning the new power tennis. The sisters were big, powerful, athletic women who grew to dominate tennis and change game forever. Their stinging serves alongside potent ground strokes ushered in an era of power players to which tennis had never seen before. Venus may hold the fastest recorded serve, but Serena’s serve is not only powerful, but also consistent, effortless and precise. It has been called the best serve ever the history of tennis. Both women have been ranked No. 1. Although Serena has held the distinction longer, Venus achieved it first—both top rankings for the sisters in 2002. They have both No. 1 in doubles, where they also excel. They reached the top spot in doubles starting in July of 2010. Venus has won 43 singles titles, while Serena holds 45. The main difference comes in major titles, where Venus holds seven career Grand Slam has reached 15 to date. Together they hold 88 singles titles—among those are 22 titles, plus each won a gold medal in singles competition. In women’s doubles, won 21 titles, Serena 22. they have won 13 Slam doubles championships. The sisters have tucked away a career Golden Slam doubles since won the doubles title at each the Slam venues, and the Olympic doubles three times. sisters also each hold two Slam mixed doubles titles. In total, it is an impressive resume. Eventually, however, power tennis took its toll—even the big girls. Davenport chose motherhood, Kim Clijsters backed away from her powerful modified all-court game, and Sharapova’s shoulder quit. Between 2008-2012, Serena and Venus played on, periodically, as they floated in and out the game—able to come back anytime and reassert themselves game they reshaped. There was still no one as dominant as either Williams sister in women's tennis. Various injuries, illnesses and personal conflicts interrupted their play, sisters often generated speculation that their interest in tennis waned. however, they would find their way back the sport. Women tend to ebb and flow from high to low, unable to sustain winning from slam to slam—except for, perhaps, Williams at age 31. Share: Originally published on: 15/12/11 10:09 Women’s tennis once resembled a chess-like battle of tactical wit, as players entertained the masses with displays of artistry, finesse and flair. Players would slice and dice, chip and charge, serve and volley, in an effort to utilise every shot in the book to outmanoeuvre an opponent. The improvements in racket technology and training methods have transformed the game of tennis since the days of consummate players like Billie Jean King, Chris Evert and Martina Navratilova. Those stars laid the foundations for game we love today but over the years tennis has been remodelled as a sport of power, athleticism, speed and endurance. While some tennis romanticists deem the new era as one-dimensional, a monotonous of aggressive baseliners whose only time spent at the net is to shake hands, others feel the current crop comprise supremely gifted athletes, who display a discipline unrivalled in other generations. The women on today’s WTA tour produce groundstrokes that rebound from their rackets like rockets and possess serves that should probably come with permits they are so lethal. One of the main reasons for this increase in power is the shift to graphite rackets from the wooden frames that were used the past. But technology hasn’t been the only factor behind the dramatic change in women’s tennis. Just as Bjorn Borg revolutionised the sport with topspin, there were also female players who reshaped game with their own unique styles. Former British pro Sue Mappin, who reached career-high world rankings of No.28 in singles and No.6 in doubles, attributes the re-styling tennis to the advent the two-handed backhand and, in particular, the style of American former world No.1 Evert. “I think the reason she was so influential was because so good,” Mappin says. “There were other players with two-handed backhands, not that many, but was successful and as soon as someone is successful with a certain way of playing you can guarantee coaches are going to be watching and saying, ‘Right, all my players will have two-handed backhands she has done so well’. When Chris came on the scene she also hit the ball very early and I suppose that was the start the penetrating groundstrokes.” Evert’s influence today’s game is difficult to underestimate, a staggering 92 per cent of women favouring a double-handed backhand the tour this year. The 18-time Grand Slam champion paved the way for a generation of hard-hitting baseliners who were additionally facilitated by the introduction of carbon fibre rackets, nylon strings and bigger racket heads. Developments in cardiovascular, agility and strength training also impacted the women’s game, contributing the finely-chiselled athletes that grace the court today. If Evert be credited with revolutionising way tennis is played, then Navratilova and Steffi Graf have be recognised as the pioneers for off-the-court conditioning that is now a vital component of professional sport. Barry Newcombe, a journalist who has covered the last 46 Wimbledon Championships, has witnessed first hand the transformation tennis players into the robust athletes of today. “They all look a lot sharper to me now,” Newcombe says about modern players. “Not just those who be the second week of a Grand Slam, but are the first week. Graf was a great athlete. She trained with the German track and field team the 1984 Olympics and they reckon a 400-metre runner straight away and had the qualities to compete at Olympic level, which showed where her fitness level was.” But players became more aggressive and stronger, and their equipment more powerful, there was an inevitable period of inconsistency women’s game. Mappin explains that a while was almost an inverse relationship between power and variety, because players started to ball harder, the diversity in their play gradually began to fade. “There a period when I used to watch the women hitting the cover off ball but was no strategy, just hitting balls as hard as possible,” she an A plan, no B plan and there certainly wasn’t a C plan. So if your hard hitting didn’t work on that particular day you weren’t successful, and you didn’t have an alternative. But now I think it is beginning to change. We are to see players looking to do more.” Mappin’s view that variety to creep back into women’s is echoed by Patrick Mouratoglou, a Frenchman has coached top 20 players such as Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova, Aravane Rezai and Marcos Baghdatis. “I don’t think that the players have become one-dimensional,” Mouratoglou argues. “Schiavone, Williams, Stosur, Azarenka, Wozniacki, Martinez-Sanchez, Vinci. Would you say that they all play the same? The women’s game has improved lot in 30 years. It has grown in terms of interest, of prizemoney, and many more young girls have the desire to develop and become professional tennis players. There is much more competition than before.” Mourataglou also believes that one the major differences has come the and return. The Williams sisters knocked the tennis world off its axis when they arrived scene the late 90s. They were the poster girls the power era with missile-like serves and a return of serve position that saw them stand three feet inside the baseline. Everything about them – their height, physique, and ability – was daunting for their opponents the get-go. While serve was once used a means of starting the point, Venus and Serena were ending points with it and competitors to take note. In 1989 only two women hit were measured at over 100 mph, but 15 years later that number had risen to 151 players. Venus currently holds the record the fastest serve of all time, clocked at 129mph, while Serena isn’t too far off a 128mph bazooka of her own. tennis once characterised by teen queens. Players who burst onto scene before their sweet 16s with little fear the established pros that stood the opposite side the net. But with two teenagers currently the world’s top 100 –Bojana Jovanovski and Christina McHale – the average age professional players is increasing. The ITF has put in place rules that limit the amount professional tournaments that girls under 18 can play, but you also to question if the excessive power in game contributed the decline in teenagers the top. “If you’re only 17, 18, 19 you are still developing,” says Mappin. “If you look at Laura Robson, has great game to build on. The fact that she is left-handed is a huge plus, is vulnerable she hasn’t got the strength yet is still growing.” So where does game develop from here? Pint-sized champions as Martina Hingis and Justine Henin broke the mould last few decades a variety to their game that troubled the most powerful players. Their success gave belief that power can be combatted and the general consensus now is the women, like the men, are starting to find ways to manage not only their opponent’s power, but own too. Aggressive hitters tour today, including Serena, have seen the need to add more variety they have duly obliged. be beaten, but Serena is simply the best player the world the moment,” said Mourataglou. “Young players are rising but they need one or two more years to develop.” We seen skillful champions and we seen powerful champions. If this the generation that combines the two, then a very bright future indeed. ‘Girl power’ featured the November 2011 issue of tennishead magazine. To subscribe, click here. NEW YORK — A long season full of tennis history behind her, Serena Williams arrived at Tuesday night's Sports Illustrated Sportsperson of the Year award ceremony at Pier 60 flanked by those who have been by her side from the start — her family. Williams, 34, was in high spirits as she made her way down the red carpet, amid calls of "Serena! Serena!" from photographers she posed and addressed TV cameras. After her family joined Venus on stage in introducing her ("I remember that little girl that would moon us," joked Isha Price), Williams spoke for 10 minutes, thanking those around her and talking the challenges she has worked through in her career on and off the court, quoting her favorite Maya Angelou poem to close. She also took a shot -- in good humor -- at American Pharoah, the Triple Crown-winning horse that was considered for the magazine's award. "I've lived through tragedies and controversies and . horses," Williams said, the room bursting into laughter. Then, turning serious: "This award makes me want to work harder . I to achieve more goals." Did Williams deserve the 'Sports Illustrated' sportsperson the year? Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian, who Williams is reportedly dating, sat at her family's table and lingered after the awards portion was complete. The only tears the night came from Venus her introduction of Serena. "It's been an honor to be your big sister," she said, wiping her eyes. "It's the best job in the world." The 21-time major champion wore a floor-length backless and strapped black dress with a lace front. "I liked the idea the throne," Williams told USA TODAY Sports the Illustrated cover. "I said, 'Listen, this needs be something that no one forgets, something iconic! I wanted it be really special. really Serena.' When we went with that, I loved it." is the first single female athlete to win the award since 1983, and first active tennis player since Chris Evert in 1976. also becomes first African American the award. Advertisement (The Root) — It's tough being a black female athlete in America, especially if you're crushing the competition in a predominantly white sport like tennis where fans have called you "nigger" midgame. In Venus and Serena, the new documentary that hit select theaters recently, director and producer Michelle Major and her team dug into the lives of the Williams sisters during 2011. With unfettered access, the cameras caught the pair practicing with their parents, recovering from injuries with blood-filled IV bags and learning from John McEnroe when to curse out referees — and Serena smooching with then-boyfriend Common. But for all the behind-the-scenes access, including a moment in which their mother, Oracene Price, fusses after being questioned by a British reporter about why Serena grunts, many critics complained that the film doesn't reveal any new information for avid tennis fans. "We've heard that, but we think it's incredibly revealing," Major told The Root. "We went into this because there was so much mythology and so many negative stories around these two women who deserved to have their stories told truthfully, whatever it was. Also, their father, Richard Williams, is portrayed in the media as [a] sinister Svengali who's 'puppeteering' his daughters, and we wanted to get to the bottom of that." One the biggest reveals is the sisters' relationship their enigmatic father, coach and ultimate motivator. It the challenge of his role in Venus' early career that creates tension the film. Specifically, when tennis coach Rick Macci is interviewed, he says that Richard wrote and asked Macci to mentor his daughters. Eco-friendly Dog TreatsYour furry friends give you the love every day, so it only makes sense that you want to give them the best in return: food that’s good for them and the planet. Macci says he did just that, even funding the family's move to Florida, where the siblings could practice around the clock, thanks the weather, and putting Richard on his payroll. However, when Venus began her athletic ascent, Richard fired Macci. When asked film about her influential coaches, Venus never mentions him. "I'm glad you saw that," Major said. "We asked her over and over again her coaches, and she'd say 'my sister' or 'my mother,' and finally she asked me, 'Who do you mean?' and that's when you hear me say, 'Rick he coached you quite a bit . ' I expected she'd bring him up, but her father is all that matters. "She doesn't feel that Macci should get any more credit than he already has," she continued. "She father are so close, and she to focus on how amazing he was, she doesn't like anybody who tries to take that credit away." Throwing a wrench in their father-daughter relationship the matter of unidentified half-siblings. Before Richard and Oracene married, Richard had another relationship that produced five children, a fact that Serena know. He has other children, too, however. One possible older brother awkwardly appears on the court next to Richard during one scene, and the next, Serena says she has no idea who the man is. "Richard Williams is a total enigma. I was talking to Richard, the other gentleman was introduced as his son," said. "I innocently asked Serena who when she gave me that answer. I didn't know if she was joking — because has a wicked sense of humor — until I asked others the family and they said, 'No, that's true [she doesn't know him].' I think that was how they were shielded their family, to not even have to experience the older siblings." One reality pair weren't sheltered from the racist underbelly of tennis the game's seemingly fickle fans. During the infamous Indian Wells Masters tournament, Williams family, Serena specifically, were booed and called "nigger" by fans. In response, Richard raised black power fist toward the crowd. Serena won, but the sisters never returned to that tournament. Serena likened their decision the anti-racism protests of Martin Luther King Jr., saying that she had to stand up for herself. "Through filming, we learned they deal with criticism through their incredible drive, especially with Serena," Major says. "She can have things broken and still win because of her mental toughness. We didn't really understand the only reason Serena plays tennis is because her big sister did. It's crazy." Ultimately, Serena is an interesting look at two African-American athletes building upon the legacy of Arthur Ashe and Althea Gibson. From the early footage sisters practicing the courts of Compton, Calif., to winning doubles at Wimbledon, theirs a bond built to defend each other and make both of them great. Serena Williams embodies style, power, beauty and courage. Currently ranked #1, Serena has overcome insurmountable odds to win 21 career Grand Slams. Not only is she remarkable at tennis, her success with endeavors outside of the sport include film, television, fashion and philanthropy. Her tennis ability combined with her off-court activity makes her one the most recognizable names and faces in the world–an icon. Serena was born September 26, 1981 in Saginaw, Michigan, to Richard and Oracene Williams. While still an infant, the family moved to Compton, California where she began playing tennis at the age of four. At nine, Serena and her to West Palm Beach, Florida. Since that time, she has become most dominant figures in tennis. A year for the records, has won four grand slams; Wimbledon, the French Open, the Australian Open, and the 2014 US Open, a feat affectionately known as the “Serena Slam.” She won a title in all four Grand Slam tournaments. won 66 singles championships, 22 doubles championships, and was also Gold-Medalist the 2000 (doubles), 2008 (doubles), and 2012 (singles and doubles) Olympics. Off the court, and acting are Serena’s passions. Serena’s acting credits include an appearance on “Drop Dead Diva”; a role as an ex-gangster on Showtime’s “Street Time”; and a leading role on an episode of Lifetime’s “The Division.” has also lent her vocal talents to “The Simpsons” and Disney’s “Higgleytown Heroes.” She also featured among 10 individuals named “Fashion Trendsetters” by Vogue Magazine on a VH1/Vogue Television Special. has used her fashion savvy to create her own clothing label, Aneres, which has been featured in In Style Magazine. You can also find Serena on HSN where her Williams Signature Statement collection is featured. Her most recent line premiered at New York Fashion Week on September 9, 2014. In 2011, Serena’s passion for nails came to fruition when she partnered with OPI her Glam Slam Series, an assortment of colors inspired by the tennis and fashion icon. The Williams Fund focuses on creating equal access to education and assisting victims of senseless community violence. To that end, Fund partners with organizations and leaders doing great work to positively impact communities the lives of other human beings both nationally and globally. This has included building schools in Kenya, serving as a UNICEF Global Ambassador, Creating the Serena Scholars to help deserving students with unmet financial need the US attend college, partnering with the Equal Justice Initiative to raise funds and awareness the work they do to name a few. Serena splits her time between Beach, Florida and Los Angeles, California her Yorkshire terrier, Chip. Football By Alex Livie Snapped up by Hamburg in 2004 from RKC Waalwijk, Boulahrouz settled in quickly in the Bundesliga and has played a key role the club's renaissance. "He is an important defender, but he is also the man to lift spirits within the squad. He is the sort of guy you need around during long evenings at training camp. "Edwin van der Sar. Boulahrouz may be slight in stature, as he stands at just 5ft 9in, he has a presence on the field that clearly feeds through the team is held in such high regard by his international colleagues. The 24-year-old made his professional debut for RKC in 2002 and quickly established himself the team, but was lured to Germany the summer of 2004. HSV fans have taken the Dutchman to their hearts has earned the nickname Khalid der Kannibale ("Khalid the Cannibal") for his ability to eat up the opposition. He international debut the 3-0 win over Liechtenstein in September 2004 and will be keen to impress the German public this summer. © 2022 Sky UK Watch Sky Sports Khalid Boulahrouz profile Around Sky Get Sports Get More from Sky Cinema Sports
